title: Thunderbird 115.2.0 vari problemi di visualizzazione
content:
Salve, utilizzo Thunderbird dal 2003, l'ho costantemente aggiornato fino ad oggi senza mai avere un singolo problema. Con l'ultima aggiornamento alla versione 115.2.0 sto avendo un paio di problemi davvero fastidiosi che non mi permettono di utilizzare lo strumento in maniera corretta. Vado per punti:

1) Ero abituato da decenni a selezionare l'ultimo messaggio del giorno e poi chiudevo Thunderbird. Al prossimo riavvio il programma mi presentava sempre l'ultima schermata aperta e si posizionava esattamente sul messaggio che avevo selezionato in precedenza. Con la versione 11.52.0 mi apre la schermata corretta, ma si posiziona casualmente trai i vecchi messaggi ricevuti, esempio si posiziona sui messaggi di Giugno 2023 e non su l'ultimo di Settembre 2023. Tutte le volte mi tocca a scrollare a mano fino ai messaggi odierni, questo comportamento non lo aveva mai fatto prima.

2) Ogni volta che cancello un messaggio, automaticamente Thunderbird mi fa uno scrolling e si posiziona sui messaggi di qualche giorno fa (comportamento davvero fastidioso). Quindi la procedura è: - Cancello un messaggio - Thunderbird mi scrolla da solo sui messaggi più vecchi - A mano utilizzo la scrollbar per tornare sull'ultimo messaggio del giorno Non so se sono riuscito a rendere bene l'idea... Qualcuno mi può aiutare ? Perché da giorni è diventato difficile usare il programma di posta, grazie. Tom

title: Setup for: Sending Mutiple Email Campaigns (using different sending email addresses)
content:
Can this be set up using Thunderbird??

1. Set it up to allow it to send Mutiple Email Campaigns at once (using different sending email addresses) - each seperatly

example:

Email Campaign 01 - using "campaigemail-address@domain.AA" - sends 50 X emails per day Email Campaign 01 - using "campaigemail-address@domain.BB" - sends 50 X emails per day Email Campaign 01 - using "campaigemail-address@domain.CC" - sends 50 X emails per day

  • Each with it's own, seperate email list

etc,,

2. Set the delivery number of emails that can be set each day & increase that number in incriments each until it reaches a max number (like 50 oer sending email address,)

3. Use tracking links in emails being sent that will allow Thunderbird to know if the receiveing person has opened the email

4, Use tracking links in emails being sent that will allow Thunderbird to know if the receiveing person has REPLIED to the email sent

5. Use an automated follow up email that is ONLY sent to those who did NOT REPLY

6. Share a central "email address sent memory file" - that ensures email addresses are NOT sent an email from another Sending email account on Thunderbird

7. All "reply emails" sent to a "shared central Inbox"

8. If I decide to "REPLY" to one of these emails, it will be sent via the SAME email address as the prospect replied to - example "campaigemail-address@domain.BB"

title: Import failed unexpectedly: Could not open file at /run/user/..../tmp-profile/prefs.js
content:
So many problems....

I tried to import a zip of older emails (please note that I have successfully imported this file 2-3yrs ago)

When attempting to import I get the following error message "Import failed unexpectedly, more information may be available in the Error Console"

So the first problem is that there is no information on how to even view the error console! I spent over an hour searching terms and reading through other posts where people ask "How do I open the error console" and their questions GETS IGNORED

Then I found a post saying you can view the Error Console via (Menu) -> Tools -> Developer Tools -> Error Console Except when I tried to open developer tools all of a sudden TBird received an unknown connection from outside the local network WTF!!!

Then I found another post saying press CTRL+SHIFT+J to open error console. WHY IS THIS INFORMATION HIDDEN!!!! WHY IS THERE NO ARTICLE ABOUT IT! Why cant you open the error console from the menu!!!!!!! I wasted hours and lots of effort on such a pointless thing

Once I found the error console I found the following error: Uncaught (in promise) DOMException: Could not open the file at /run/user/1000/app/org.mozilla.Thunderbird/tmp-profile/prefs.js

Thinking that the problem is file access since flatpaks are notorious for being picky about file permissions I temporarily unlocked the permissions (using flatseal) and restarted thunderbird ...at which point my existing email accounts disappeared!!!

I am completely unamused!

<tl:dr> Running Thunderbird 115.2.0 (64-bit) via Flatpak on an Ubuntu 20 kernal Attempting to import a zip of old emails results in "Import failed unexpectedly, more information may be available in the Error Console" because of the error Uncaught (in promise) DOMException: Could not open the file at /run/user/1000/app/org.mozilla.Thunderbird/tmp-profile/prefs.js this file has previously been imported 2-3yrs ago (when import was still an addon)

How do I import the file

title: Thunderbird 115  2023 oauth change, TH repeatedly asks for my hotmail password
content:
The latest Thunderbird 115 and later used the Microsoft mandated new login protocol. I authorized Thunderbird on my hotmail email accounts and it is able to log in and get my emails. But Thunderbird randomly popup up a Microsoft hotmail login box asking me to log into one of my hotmail accounts. Thunderbird is not remembering to not responding the the Microsoft request for a saved password and passes the login prompt to me.

And even after I log in sometime the save prompt will be asked again sometime later. There seems to be some type of timing issue where Thunderbird is not responding to Microsoft's request for password or Thunderbird is not recognizing the request or something because sometimes it is not passing the saved password to Microsoft.

Another clue is that randomly I will see the outline of the Microsoft prompt box but no text appear for about 10 seconds and then go away. The box cannot be moved, closed, and is fixed on top of any windows I had open. In this case Thunderbird must have responded to the prompt but late/slow enough for the box to be rendered. This is why I suggested a possible timing or reconfiguration problem.

This started in August as soon as the 115 version came out and continues today. I have 10 hotmail accounts that Thunderbird is logging into and download messages from every 15 minutes. This also maybe causing a problem with Thunderbird. I would imagine most people do not have this many email accounts with Microsoft. I never have this problem with my gmail account.
